lines.text: [last lines]
How'd you escape?
Jack Flack always escapes.
I don't need him anymore. I've got you, Dad.

[into walkie-talkie]
Jack Flack to Lady Ace. Come in, Lady Ace.

[into walkie-talkie]
Yeah, Davey. What is it?
Come on, Kim. Play right.
Fine. Fine. Lady Ace to Jack Flack. Do you read me?
Loud and clear. I'll proceed to the building and you follow me in.
This is what I meant by "embarrassing".
The following material is for A-4 security clearance personnel only... it is a federal crime to view such material without proper authorization.
Jack?
[Davey moves to the wall and runs his hands over the bullet holes caused by Rice's automatic weapon]

[Jack materializes, sitting on the ground under the bullet holes. He stands up]
Hey! Congrats Davey, you won!
I thought he shot you...
Nah, never touched me
[Jack begins to pad himself down making sure he wasn't hit. He picks up his beret and runs his fingers through it, finding one bullet hole]
Hmm.

[Davey runs his hands over the bullet holes again]
But he could see you...

[Jack puts his beret back on]
Ah, probably didn't have much imagination anyway.
[Jack moves over to the edge of the riverwalk, and sees Rice, face down, floating down river]
Huh. Tough break.
[Jack looks back to Davey and notices him belwidered at what just happened, and holds him by the shoulders]
Look Davey, you killed the bad guys, you won the game! Well, how do you feel?
[Jack rubs Davey's head, messing up his hair in a "good job" gesture]
It wasn't fair. You made me shoot, you made me kill him!
[Davey begins to back away from Jack]
Ah, classic self defense. Come on, let's go save Kim!
[Jack moves to grab Davey's arm]

[Davey throws down his Jack Flack minature figure and stomps on it three times, breaking off the plastic base]
I don't wanna play anymore!
Oh. Sigh, Why does this always have to happen? They grow up, they forget, they...
[Jack looks down Davey's broken minature figure of himself on the ground]
break their toys...
What?
Your father said the same thing.
[a slow dripping sound is heard, like liquid on leather, slow at first, then quickens. Jack looks down at his chest, noticing it's coming from him]
Hmm? Damn.
[Jack has begun to bleed from several entry wounds where the bullets hit him]
He did hit you!
[Davey moves to Jack's side]
Ah, I'll be all right, come on...
But, you're bleeding...
Ah, Oh!

[Jack takes a couple of steps forward, then falls back against the wall, breathing heavy and slowly starts to slide down the wall to a sitting position, Davey slides down with him, trying to support his friend]
Oh!
[takes a razzled breath]
Hey I got an idea, maybe...
[Jack struggles to stay focused]
maybe you should go on without me...
Don't say that, you'll be fine!
[Davey begins looking around for help]
You know, I always hated that part... leaving... when they stopped believing...
I'll go get some help...
[Davey starts to get up]
No No, don't go.
[Jack roughly manages a smile, knowing the end is near]
They... they wouldn't be able to see me anyway.
But... I need you Jack...
[tears begin to roll down Davey's cheek, as he realizes his friend is dying]
Ah, go on. You're growing up now,
[Jack reaches to touch Davey's cheek and wipe away a tear]
you don't need an ol' jolly pistol around like me anymore.
But... Jack Flack always escapes...
You wanna know something?
[Jack smiles]
You're the best playmate I ever had. Tell you what,
[Jack looks behind Davey to the table with the umbrella]
, why don't you go over there and get me a smoke? Over there, go on.

[Davey stands and walks towards the table, looking for the ciagarettes. The camera pans back to Jack, who flickers twice, a look of pain on his face, and then disappears]
Jack?
[Davey moves back to where Jack was sitting]
Jack come back, I can't do it on my own!
Jack Flack always escapes.
It's not fair. Jack Flack always escapes. How does he do it, Morris? I had ten times as many bullets.
Yeah, but Flack had ingenuity and the contacts, Kim. That's better than bullets sometimes.
if we were at war, I'd want him on my side.

[materializes from behind the bedroom door as Davey's father is walking down the hall]
Not too smart for a military man, huh?
Shut up!
[throws his Jack Flack miniature figure at Jack, who gasps in surprise and vanishes]
Not that way Davey! It's a dead end!

[Jack doesn't re-materialize, but Davey hears his voice clearly]
Yes you can! You were always on your own. Save Kim, Davey!
[Davey looks to his watch, seeing how much time is left to get to the airport before the bomb explodes]

[Davey grabs up the Jack Flack minature figure off the game board and puts it in his pocket]
. Time to go, Jack!

[realizing that he has backed himself into a corner, Davey raises the pistol]
Don't come any closer or I'll shoot...

[Rice approaches Davey, slowly emerging from under the darkened bridge]
Yeah sure you will, red ink. Only this one
[taps the semi-automatic he holds, complete with silencer, as he is speaking]
shoots real bullets.
[Rice pulls the reload switch on the weapon for effect]
I'm warning you! This is not a water pistol...
Neither is this. I could turn you into shredded meat in about, uh, three seconds with this baby if I wanted to.
[Rice continues to advance on Davey, slowly]

[materializes next to Davey]
Shoot him. Just pull the trigger and shoot him, Davey.
Jack, I...
[Davey looks quickly to Jack and back to the advancing Rice, unsure what to do]
All right, I'll show you what a real hero would do, watch this!
[Jack moves to the next wall to the right of Davey]
Jack?

[the camera pans to Jack who now appears translucent, somewhat ghostly. Rice, confused, looks to Jack's direction and squints, apparently he can see someone, but he is unsure of who or what he is exactly seeing. Jack has taken off his hat and is now holding it over his chest]
Come on, Turkey! Shoot! Come on! Right Here! Come on, Hit Me! Pull the trigger!...

[Davey looks to where Jack is standing, quickly glances back to Rice, and back to Jack, realizing that Jack is about to be shot]
Jack, don't!
[Rice turns to Jack's direction and fires many rounds, we see Jack being hit by the shots and pushed back into the wall]
NO!
[Davey turns back to Rice quickly, points and shoots]
GAGH!
[Rice is hit in the chest and falls back into the river, dead]
Freeze turkey!
[Rice steps back, apparently startled that a kid has a gun, Davey looks back quickly to see Kim running up the steps, then back to Rice]
Take my advice, don't follow us...
[Davey begins to back away, moving in Kim's direction]
You little punk!
[Rice lunges towards Davey, trying to grab the gun, Davey pulls the trigger which shoots red ink, momentarily blinding Rice]
Gagh!
[Davey uses the moment of surprise and runs off]
. Wha?
[Rice dabs at his eyes, wiping away the red ink and trying to determine which way the kids ran]
